content: Anglican bishop (1905–1972) **Henry Wolfe Baines** (2 February 1905 – 29 November 1972) was an [Anglican](/wiki/Anglican) [bishop](/wiki/Bishop). ## Early life Baines was born in 1905 in [Kingston, Surrey](/wiki/Kingston_upon_Thames), the son of Talbot Baines and his wife Agnes (née Talbot). He was educated at [St George's School, Windsor Castle](/wiki/St_George%27s_School,_Windsor_Castle), [Repton School](/wiki/Repton_School) and [Balliol College, Oxford](/wiki/Balliol_College,_Oxford). He was then a travelling secretary for the [Student Christian Movement](/wiki/Student_Christian_Movement_of_Great_Britain) (1927–1929). ## Clerical career After theological studies at [Cuddesdon College](/wiki/Ripon_College_Cuddesdon) he was ordained deacon in 1930 and priest in 1931, and began his ordained ministry as a [curate](/wiki/Curate) at the [University Church of St Mary the Virgin](/wiki/University_Church_of_St_Mary_the_Virgin) (1930–1934). From 1934 he was [chaplain](/wiki/Chaplain) of [St. John's Cathedral, Hong Kong](/wiki/St._John%27s_Cathedral,_Hong_Kong), then [Vicar](/wiki/Vicar) of [St Nicholas' Church, Radford, Coventry](/wiki/St_Nicholas%27_Church,_Radford,_Coventry) (1938–1941) and finally, before his ordination to the [episcopate](/wiki/Episcopate), the Rector of [St Andrew's Church, Rugby](/wiki/St_Andrew%27s_Church,_Rugby) (1941–1949) and [Rural Dean](/wiki/Rural_Dean) of [Rugby](/wiki/Rugby,_Warwickshire) (1947–1949). In 1949 he became [Bishop of Singapore](/wiki/Bishop_of_Singapore). He was consecrated bishop on 29 June 1949, by [Geoffrey Fisher](/wiki/Geoffrey_Fisher), [Archbishop of Canterbury](/wiki/Archbishop_of_Canterbury), at [St Paul's Cathedral](/wiki/St_Paul%27s_Cathedral) (London, UK). In 1960 he was [translated](/wiki/Translation_(ecclesiastical)) to be the [Bishop of Wellington](/wiki/Diocese_of_Wellington); he died in office. [Church of England titles](/wiki/Church_of_England)Preceded by[John Leonard Wilson](/wiki/John_Leonard_Wilson) **[Bishop of Singapore](/wiki/Bishop_of_Singapore)** 1949–1960Succeeded by[Cyril Kenneth Sansbury](/wiki/Cyril_Kenneth_Sansbury)Preceded by[Reginald Herbert Owen](/wiki/Reginald_Herbert_Owen) **[Bishop of Wellington](/wiki/Diocese_of_Wellington)** 1960–1972Succeeded by[Edward Kinsella Norman](/wiki/Edward_Kinsella_Norman) This article about an [Anglican](/wiki/Anglican) [bishop](/wiki/Bishop) is a stub. title: Henry Baines (bishop)
